meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she won the race and got a shiny medal.
meanings.sent2: He won the lottery and became very happy.
meanings.sent3: The cat won the staring contest against the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her smile won over the hearts of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The team's hard work finally won them the championship trophy.

meanings.definition: to be victorious or successful in a competition or game
meanings.sent1: The team won the soccer match with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent2: She won the spelling bee by correctly spelling every word.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel won the acorn-hunting game against the chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: His determination won him the title of chess champion.
meanings.sent5: The student won the math competition by solving all the problems quickly.

meanings.definition: to achieve victory or success in a struggle or conflict
meanings.sent1: After a long debate, she won the argument with a strong point.
meanings.sent2: The country won its independence after years of fighting.
meanings.sent3: The little ant won the battle against the big grasshopper.
meanings.sent4: His kindness and patience won him the trust of his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team won the match against the champions, surprising everyone.
